pullsbody:
The things in this repository are to be used solely for testing
purposes. This fixes the comments so that it's clearer that we intended
to check these keys in and why that's ok.

Fixes #22.

The things in this repository are to be used solely for testing
purposes. This fixes the comments so that it's clearer that we intended
to check these keys in and why that's ok.

This explicitly sets the Docker version. If we don't set the version,
CircleCI defaults to using 17.03.0 which is a version that CircleCI is
deprecating.

Update docker version

This explicitly sets the Docker version. If we don't set the version,
CircleCI defaults to using 17.03.0 which is a version that CircleCI is
deprecating.

pullsbody:
There are two main use cases for this repo. The first is building the
oidc-testprovider Docker image which helps teams do local development by
acting as an OIDC OP. The second is building a bunch of images used by
mozilla-django-oidc and other things for e2e tests.

Since the first is the one used by other people, it makes sense to focus
on documentation for that so it's easier for people to use.
pull_repo_desc: Dockerized setup for ``mozilla-django-oidc`` local dev and testing
pull_commit_message:
Improve README

There are two main use cases for this repo. The first is building the
oidc-testprovider Docker image which helps teams do local development by
acting as an OIDC OP. The second is building a bunch of images used by
mozilla-django-oidc and other things for e2e tests.

Since the first is the one used by other people, it makes sense to focus
on documentation for that so it's easier for people to use.

This also updates image names.

pull_repo_desc: Dockerized setup for ``mozilla-django-oidc`` local dev and testing

Fix image names

This fixes the build rules to create image names as expected in the
.circleci/config.yml file.

This also fixes the pull rules to pull the latest version of the images.

pull_repo_desc: Dockerized setup for ``mozilla-django-oidc`` local dev and testing

pullsbody:
We're going to push all the images as tags to a single oidc-testprovider repo under mozilla user in dockerhub. This updates the docker tag and push bits accordingly.

This repository is called `docker-test-mozilla-django-oidc` which is too long, so we shortened it to `oidc-testprovider` which is the image that's interesting to most people.
pull_repo_desc: Dockerized setup for ``mozilla-django-oidc`` local dev and testing
pull_commit_message:
Update dockerhub bits

We're going to push all the images as tags to a single oidc-testprovider
repo under mozilla user in dockerhub. This updates the docker tag and
push bits accordingly.

pulltitle: Fix CircleCI to push all images
pullsbody:
This fixes the CircleCI code to push all the images.

Previously, there were only `latest` images. It's better to have git tags that correspond to specific images. Then users don't have images change without their intervention and if we ever goof, someone can downgrade to a previously working image.

This removes the tag, push, and release rules from the Makefile since tagging, pushing, and releasing will all be done by CircleCI going forward.

I also adjusted the README to have the dockerhub url for `oidc_testprovider`.

I also added a note about nip.io. We use that in Socorro. It made some things easier and reduced startup steps.
pull_repo_desc: Dockerized setup for ``mozilla-django-oidc`` local dev and testing
pull_commit_message:
Fix CircleCI configuration to tag and push all images

This fixes the CircleCI configuration tag and push all images. They're
pushed both with the tag pushed to GitHub as well as with "latest".

This removes the Makefile rules for tagging, pushing, and releasing
since that's now handled in CircleCI configuration.

pulltitle: Fix CircleCI to push all images
pullsbody:
This fixes the CircleCI code to push all the images.

Previously, there were only `latest` images. It's better to have git tags that correspond to specific images. Then users don't have images change without their intervention and if we ever goof, someone can downgrade to a previously working image.

This removes the tag, push, and release rules from the Makefile since tagging, pushing, and releasing will all be done by CircleCI going forward.

I also adjusted the README to have the dockerhub url for `oidc_testprovider`.

I also added a note about nip.io. We use that in Socorro. It made some things easier and reduced startup steps.
pull_repo_desc: Dockerized setup for ``mozilla-django-oidc`` local dev and testing

pullsbody:
I don't know if there are other things the `createuser` command should do.

Also, since the container uses sqlite, we probably need to mention that you need to be running the container and then `exec` into it. I didn't know how to communicate that well in the README. Thoughts?

Fixes #4

I don't know if there are other things the `createuser` command should do.

Also, since the container uses sqlite, we probably need to mention that you need to be running the container and then `exec` into it. I didn't know how to communicate that well in the README. Thoughts?

Fixes #4

pulltitle: Load bootstrap and other assets from CDN
pullsbody: Load the pinax-bootstrap-theme assets from CDNs, with integrity hashes: * Bootstrap 3.3.7 * Font Awesome 4.4.0 * jQuery 2.2.4 This required setting the Site object, which defaults to example.com, and reformatting the templates to work with bootstrap. This PR fixes issue #3. Here's what testprovider currently looks like: And here is what it looks like after this change:
